Reviews.Title: “Rome leisure trip and taxis”
Reviews.Author: Goldnick
Reviews.Content: Our trip was essentially for us as a couple to take her 89 year-old father to see the Vatican and St Peter's. Our 18 year-old daughter tagged along as well. Hotel - fairly good Holiday Inn, very acceptably clean, very good food, and very attentive staff except for housekeeping which seemed to miss cleaning the odd mug in the room / not topping up the tea / coffee supplies. Coffee in the bar was less than half the price in central Rome. We secured a shower room (disabled) for the father-in-law but there was no tea / coffee in this and we could not get the heating to work. He did not mind as it was spring time. Although the hotel's location may seem out of the centre, it is good for Fiumicino airport when you just want to get in/out with no traffic hold-ups. Taxis - having researched here first, I was wary of taking a taxi before leaving the airport building. They pounced and offered me a fare of 63 EUR to the HI. Once I saw this 'official' fare I said I was going to take a white taxi instead and picked one up outside the airport building. Our average fare to / from the HI was 43 EUR. From HI to St Peter's Square we ranged from 15.20 EUR on a quiet evening to 31 EUR on a busy morning when we were taken in the opposite direction to pick up an 'alternative' route. It is best to make sure that they will charge by the meter. We had one trip offered and accepted by us at 26 EUR and were driven maniacally overtaking other white taxis in the central taxi lane at traffic lights and jumping other lights. Compared with the 15.20 the next night, it did not seem such good value although some in my party enjoyed the entertainment. Tour - we found the 110 bus excellent at 18 EUR for 48 hours to take us North and East from St Peter's (via della Concliazone) covering the train station (Termini), Colosseum, and Trevi Fountains / Spanish Steps. Just jump off wherever at any of the 10 stops, explore, and jump back on the next one. There seems to be one every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: dparrish0
Reviews.Content: We used Expedia's 'secret saver hotel' in hopes of finding a fun hotel in Trastevere. We lost that gamble and ended up at Holiday Inn Rome Aurelia. The location was a bit crap if you are wanting to visit the city centre but the hotel itself was ok. Breakfast is expensive so we didn't pay for it. There is a grocery store very close so we bought breakfast foods and ate them in the room (ours had a small fridge). Because the location is crap, the hotel offers a shuttle bus to the city centre but it limits your options for arriving and departing the city. I wouldn't bother with the shuttle because public transport is really easy. You can buy bus tickets at a tabachi next door to the grocery store. Take bus 246 or 247 (don't forget to stamp you ticket on the bus) to the metro stop Cornelia, you will see a McDonald's on the left hand corner when you need to get off. The bus ticket will also work on the metro so use the same ticket and head into town. It is easy, quick and it only costs 1 euro per person instead of the 5 euro that the shuttle costs. The hotel says they have air conditioning but they fail to mention that they can't turn it on until May. We didn't need it in April but it would have been nice to have it. The 24 hour room service is limited after 23:00 because the kitchen closes. We got in really late on the night of our arrival and could only get sandwiches. Not ideal but understandable. Overall, I think this hotel would be fine for business travelers or for those who have a car who are using Rome as a base for exploring outside of the city (wouldn't drive in the city) but I wouldn't recommend it for those wanting to explore the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel in Rome when you have a rental car”
Reviews.Author: charlie m
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Rome Aurelia (or Rome West) is on Via Aurelia (SS1) and just a few minutes from the Intersection with the GRA (Grande Raccordo Anulare - Roman Ring Road around the city) which makes it a great hotel for visitors with a rental car or someone who needs to be near the airport. Although I have been to Rome about 12 times I usually don't drive in the city itself....too much traffic, too many little streets and it is difficult to find your way while being surrounded by impatient drivers. While you are not in the center of Rome the hotel offers a shuttle or you can easily use the local bus line and the Metro to get around. The hotel is just average, nothing special...they offer a decent breakfast. We have been there at least six times. It is a good starting point for day trips to the Colle Albani (Roman hill towns) or to other locations around the city. It is not cheap, but reasonable for Rome and the HI website does offer specials at various times. They have onsite secure, paid parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, feels like america.”
Reviews.Author: carlosbar
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit Rome and yet feels like you are in america, this is the place. Very kind people at the front desk, quick services, fast taxi service. The breakfast (you can buy this together if you will) is the most like-american breakfast I found 'till now. Eggs, bacon, sausage, a sort of breads, juices and omelets or eggs prepared on the go. The neighborhood is very friendly, there is a McDonald's just next door! The hotel is located at in sort of a small trip mall that contains a mini market (carrefour express), a gas station, a kind of corner bakery and the before mentioned McDonald's. The avenue they are located is a fast avenue with bus to subway or train, this will take probably 10 minutes to get there. The Taxi from here to Vatican City or the Coliseum is about 15 euros. The rooms are quite good, with a desk, a big TV, king size bed and a toilet with bathtub - clean and cozy. There is wifi or cable internet in the room, this cost 9 euros per 24hs. This is also possible to get internet wifi at the lobby for 5 euros/day or yet use internet in computers provided at the lobby for free. Cons: You have to pay for Internet, the breakfast does not include regional food. Pros: Price, Cozy, Clean, Calm and Quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: A quiet hotel, a bit far out of the city, but it was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a mix of hot English style and continental. There didn't appear to be many people around, although the hotel was holding some sort of business type function on the Friday evening. Wine was 10 euro's a bottle, but no atmosphere in the bar area as no one else in there. Hotel fine if you are taking taxi's (20 euro's to the Vatican) but if there is a taxi strike and the metro is undergoing maintenance (as it was when we arrived) then the whole experience could resemble a living nightmare. I have to say though, that the duty manager Fabio and his colleagues were more than helpful and polite. The one time we did arrive by metro to the Cornelia station there were no taxi's and we had to take the 246 bus to the Supermarket Panorama (purchase your ticket from the Tabac). from there it is a scary walk alongside a duel carriageway in the pitch black. Or, if you are in the know! you can walk through the grounds of the neighbouring hotel which was called the Jolly.....? This seems a much safer option. Nice hotel but not that convenient.

Reviews.Title: “It's allright.”
Reviews.Author: dooandherb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off SS1 Aurelia. If you are driving towards Rome Centre on SS1 and you have passed the bus depot on the right then go to the right lane to use the next exit, make a U turn utilizing the overpass. ( if you miss that one, the next right exit will let you do a turn around using a traffic light). Go back on the hwy heading towards the Ring, stay in the right lane. Just after the Panorama (think Walmart type store) there is an electronica store and then the exit. There is a small sign saying Holiday inn. If you miss it, turn into the Mc Donalds/Gas station and you will be able to back track. Check in took some time as they need passports for all guests and enter it in the computer. There is a 3 euro a day per person city tax, parking is free and relatively plentifull. Although they run conventions during the day, the parking fills up around 9 am and frees up again later in the afternoon. Internet, is NOT free. Several options (something not to love as oppose to what their sign says.) in the lobby area only, wireless for 5 euro a day you need to get a new code every day from the front desk and it is good from 7am till 7am the next day. There are 4 computers in the lobby with chargeable internet access. In the room there is a wireless Vodafone signal, 1 hr = 3 euro, 6hr = 6 euro, 24 hr= 10 euro. As a priority club platinum elite member I received 1 free code once during a 3 day stay and I had to ask for it. (Really ICH???) Shuttle bus into town, is very well explained and taken care off and it leaves/pickes up on time. Thank you. It is 5 euro's per person round trip so it is 1 euro more per ticket than a 24 hour bus/metro pass. It is a good deal as they drop you off in a location to see all the sites. Colosseum is about 10 minutes from drop off point. Drop off is near Piazza Venezzia. The bus was clean and timely. Room. The room was a typical holiday inn room. The bathroom was a good size, plenty of amenities and water pressure. Furnishings were in good shape, however there is NO coffee maker in the room, did have a fridge and a lcd tv, (decent size) There were 2 English channels, CNN and some type of movie channel, the rest is all Italian and 1 German broadcast The cleaniless was ok, it was not super clean (you know that look and feeling you get when it is), however it was not dirty either. In between. Restaurant. They are open for Breakfast at 6.30 am I believe and it looked good. I only had coffee from them which is 1.50 euro each. We did have dinner there and it was blah to ok, overpriced, the red wine was served too cold, the maitre d' was not pleasant nor inviting; waitress was good. We did not go back the next day. Pool was closed due to the time of year. Front desk service was good, with everyone being to communicate in English. All major credit cards accepted. Some hallway carpet needs replacing. Wake up call was done 10 minute late !!!!!! Location, It is about a 30 minute car drive to FCO airport. Next to the Panorama is a Tabachi, where you can buy the bus/metro ticket to use the public transportation system. Bus 247 will take you to the Metro Cipro/ Vatican station and from there you can use the rest of the Metro to get around. Coming back with the bus (247) get off at the Panorama and walk to the hotel (10 min) Getting onto the bus to go to Rome is a bit tricker. If you have a bus ticke,t it is easy, use the overpass near the Panorama and hop on the bus. If you donot have one and you need to find another Tabachi, other than the one next to the Panorama, Stay on the left side of the highway, there are some dangerous spots and then a side walk will appear. Buy a ticket at the next T. and cross the street. The bus seems to run every 15 min. There is an Aurelia trainstation. (near the Bus depot) where you can park your car and hop on a train. Bus is easier. The tickets are single use, 1, 2 or 3 day. Figure out what you need, the system is very easy to navigate and properly marked. In short. It is ok, nothing spectacular. Decent location, blah food, decent rooms, no free internet. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and nice”
Reviews.Author: Myfuny_kids
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel very much. Rooms are quite big,nice and clean, service is at the level, food is good.Very clean, everything had been very good during my stay! The way to the hotel is just amazing full of green areas and nice historical building, also near by the hotel a big park where you can go jogging or just enjoy walking around.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexa2706
Reviews.Content: good: position (little quiet green zone 10 minutes by cheap hotel shuttle from city center) Room just enough space (junior suite); clean 4 Italian standards; very friendly, helpful staff: great sleep quality; value for money bad: unusually expensive hotel restaurant 4 Italian standards; nothing to see around hotel only McDonald's on gas station;

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy and not a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Canada_Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour in October/November. We stayed here on our last night before we flew out of Rome. The location is not close to any of the sites. Our tour group stayed on the same floor (it was either the 2nd or 3rd floor). Walking down the hall, there was missing wallpaper and it was obvious that there had been a leak. In our room, there was quite a bit of mould around the vent, so we made sure not to turn the vent on. Others in our tour said that they had mould too. We had 3 single beds in our room. The room was small, but we expected this for Europe. The beds were comfortable. The staff didn't really go out of their way to do anything memorable for us (They wouldn't make a coffee for us to take to the airport, as we were leaving at about 6am, even though our cab driver saw the man at the front desk get himself a coffee!). They did call us a cab though. It costs 50 euros to get to the airport. We would not stay here again, as it isn't even really that close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “If in Roma get in Holday INN”
Reviews.Author: ru80
Reviews.Content: Located slightly far from the city Holiday Inn Aurelia was is a decent pleasent place to stay in Rome. Like most european place I found it less spacious but otherwise the service, staff and food of the place was quite good and place was economical as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: steve1708
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, was ok, no problems, normal IHG standards, my only real moan and it seems to be the same at most of Holiday Inns nowadays is that breakfast does not start until 0630 which is too late for those of us on business and on early flights. Do not stay here to be close to the airport tho!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the Best of Italy Globus 11 day tour in mid Sep 2011. Remember when you are out of your normal surroundings things are different. They will not be the same as you are use to. Take it with a grain of salt and make the best of it. Hotels and food are not what you are use to. Know that going into the vacation. We had a small room. No safe or wireless. Clean hotel. Has frig, bar, pool (closed in mid Sep) flat screen TV Very small shower only no bath, has shampoo, bath gel a/c is just ok. Mattress is comfortable compared to other hotels we've stayed. For those leaving early they provide a box breakfast. The tour company makes sure you get transportation back to airport. Don't forget to bring your plug adapter.

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed in the Holiday Inn Rome Aurelia Hotel (Oct 2011)”
Reviews.Author: 107Robert
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on 7th Oct 2011 and we found the whole experience excellent. I was originally concerned because some of the reveiews i read were negative, however i found this was not to be the case. The food was exellent, the rooms were extremley clean and the staff were very accomodating and polite.Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “THERE ARE BETTER HOTELS IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: NelVB
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for our last day thinking it would be a good way to ease back into the US frame of mind and get closer to the Fiumicino airport - mistake. Cost from the Roma Termini was 60 euros for four of us with luggage - took over half an hour - only to find out the time and cost to the Airport the next morning was going to take just as long and cost just as much, even if it was only 9 miles from the airport!. No place to eat around the hotel within walking distance except McDonald's and the very expensive hotel restaurant, which did not open for dinner until 7:30 pm and only had a buffet for 28 euros per person. The buffet was excellent, with a variety of dishes, but the pasta was limited to two varieties, which were not particularly satisfying. Staff not too friendly or accommodating. Room was tight, but bed and pillows were AWESOME and comfortable. Bathroom was spacious and beautiful. Pool was closed and dirty. Wouldn't stay here for more than one night - was over 200 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Our bidet "farted".”
Reviews.Author: peela
Reviews.Content: I was a little afraid to stay here based on past reviews, but in my case I didn't have much choice. The major issues seem to be the staff and the location. First of all, the staff was very friendly, nice and helpful--we did not have any issues at all with the staff. We were not part of a tour group, we were just a couple traveling independently. Our room was clean, quiet, and appeared to be newly remodeled--we were on the third floor of the "tower" part, with a decent view overlooking the parking lot behind the hotel. The air conditioning worked well and was quiet. The only visible issue was a moldy area on the wall in the bathroom above the shower/tub. I also think that maybe there is a venting problem with the plumbing because our bidet "farted" when we turned on the sink faucet in the bathroom. Initially I blamed this on my husband because I kept hearing gassy noises whenever we were not in the same room (one of us in the bathroom, the other in the bed area). He denied having a problem, and claimed it was the plumbing. I subsequently had to agree with him after spending more time in the bathroom. This was not really a problem as it did not impact our comfort or use of the room, all it did was make me smile every time I turned on the faucet. We were happy with the variety of breakfast foods offered and the restaurant staff was gracious. The other big issue with this hotel is the location, which is unfortunate. The neighborhood itself is nothing special--not at all pleasant to walk around here. We did not see any "ladies of the night" but I would not have been surprised if I did. The quickest, easiest way to get here from the airport is to take a taxi, but this is also the most expensive and potentially a ripoff if you aren't a savvy traveler. We took the Cotral bus from the airport to the Cornelia metro station, then picked up the local bus #246 that goes past the hotel--total cost less than 5 euros each. This was not easy--it took a couple of hours for us to figure it all out, and we had to rely on some kind local people to let us know when to get off the buses (we would never had known otherwise). The local bus was absolutely packed full of sweaty bodies, and our luggage was being closely studied by a fellow who was so engrossed in figuring out what might be in our bags that he wasn't aware that we were on to him. To get into the city, the hotel provides an air conditioned, comfortable shuttle service which is 5 euros round trip. It only runs at set times and you must reserve a seat on it ahead of time. This is the best way to go, as public transportation from this location is a bit of a pain (see above) and taxis are a bit of a financial risk. The only problem with the shuttle is that there is one drop off/pickup location in the city, which may be far from what you want to see that day. You must be at the pickup on time or miss it--this means you may have to cut short your sightseeing and constantly check your watch while estimating how much time you need to get back to the shuttle stop. Overall, although the staff and room were nice, my biggest issue was the location and I would advise staying in downtown Rome or at least within a safe walkable proximity to a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in downtown Rome, not here.”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel096
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel three separate times (a total of 4 nights) during a two-week bus trip in Italy. The last night we stayed in a different section of the hotel which looked like it may have been remodeled; we had a double bed and the bathroom had new fixtures. But the walls still looked old and cracked. The first two rooms we stayed in had single beds which could not be moved together. And the hair dryer didn't work in either room. They advertise Internet service, but it was never working. But the lobby was large and had an area where our group could meet together and enjoy time with each other. The breakfast room was nice, but breakfast wasn't anything special. This hotel caters to large groups. It's about 20 minutes away from downtown Rome. I would have rather stayed in Rome, but understand that it was more convenient for the large group to be in a hotel outside the city. It's between the city and the airport. The only restaurant nearby, other than the one in the hotel, is a McDonald's. When we checked in the first time, the elevator wasn't working, so most of us ended up dragging our suitcases up the stairs. The third time we were in the newer building, but that elevator didn't work either. We had to use a service elevator. If you're not traveling with a group, I would not recommend this hotel. Stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Jackie C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband for a week; longer than most guests. We ate in the restaurant very night and found the restaurant boss very conscientious and concerned that we were enjoying the food. We were, especially when they had a special buffet with a wood fired oven for freshly grilled sea bass etc. Also loved the porchetta but my favorite dish was pasta with octopus and king prawns. Breakfast was good too; didn't discover the orange squeezing machine until halfway through visit but made up for lost time. Room was fine and clean. Swimming pool well looked after and great after long day in the hot city. My tip is to hire bikes to sight see and zoom down the backstreets with a cool breeze. The hotel bus was convenient to use and good value. They even transported a bike for us in the hold one day. I was concerned to see the negative reports about the staff in this hotel because they made us feel very welcome. It almost felt like a family run hotel. Am missing Franco keeping a beady eye on the smooth running of his restaurant domain and checking the food up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “A lousy hotel and the same type of staff to complete it”
Reviews.Author: Cee302
Reviews.Content: My ordeal started on Wednesday, July 20th when I arrived from Venice for a one night stay at this lousy hotel. Arrived at the front desk, was greeted and given a room number 320. No bell man to help me with my luggages but I didn't ask for that help so I can understand. I hauled all my luggage to the the room. The hallway carpets were dirty, filthy and smelt of smoke. I went into my room unpacked a few things and made my way downstairs to the restaurant because my daughter wanted to have a bite. At the restaurant I was told to wait outside for a new minutes while they made our table ready. After a few minutes,we were taken to our table. A few minutes later a waiter brought us the menu and explained what they had. I wasn't really hungry so we ordered a pizza for my daughter. As we waited for the food to arrive and noticed the other waiters/waitresses going to other tables to ask if they needed anything and no body came to ours. About ten minutes later, our food was brought to the table and I didin't see any waiter untill we walked to the cashier and asked her to put the bill on my room reservation and walked out. I certainly didn't add a tip to it because they didn't desire it. I then stopped at the front desk to ask if our room was a smoking or non smoking since I had requested a non-smoking room. I was told my room was indeed a smoking room and I was going to be given a nonsmoking room on the first floor. The change was made and I was given a new key. I pulled one of the bell man's luggage cart and headed to my room, loaded my luggages and took the elevator to the first floor and started looking for room 126 to no avail. I then went back to the front desk and asked where room 126 was. I was told it was on the other side of the hotel. I hauled the cart with my luggages to the first elevator, went in and pressed 1. It took me to the 3rd floor and back to 0. Tried the 2nd elevator and the same happened. I went back to the front desk and was told I could use the service elevator. When back and was met by a waitress who was taking food upstairs who rudely told me I couldn't use the elevator and I responded back with a yes I can per the instructions of the front desk personnel. That elevator did not work either so I went back to the front desk. This time, the front desk personnel, stopped what he was doing and accompanied me to the elevator. All three elevators did not work for him either and that's when he said we had to use the stairs. When we got to my room, I let him know the money I was using to pay for that hotel room didn't have a color attached to it so therefore I needed to be treated with respect and dignity. He claimed, for him, I didn't see "my skin color" he attempted to apologize for the unfortunate situation. This lousy hotel doesn't have a shuttle to the airport. They will call a taxi for you for 50 Euros. Their shuttle to take you to the city center charges 5 euros per person. The location is out of the way and you can't take a bus, your only choice is a taxi. What a lousy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel before going home”
Reviews.Author: Italytwin
Reviews.Content: Globus Tours used this hotel the night before people flew home. It is near the airport; yet 30-40 min away from Rome. Spacious lobby, friendly staff and large dining room for complimentary breakfast. Bed was comfortable; clean room. My bathroom had a shower stall only and it was located against the sink. Small for tall people. Recommend this hotel when traveling home; would not stay here if sight seeing in Rome...too far.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbieeaton22
Reviews.Content: No way should this place be 4*. Room was full of damp and bugs. Shower was broken. Staff completey unhelpful and unfriendly. Food was awful quality and very little choice. Nearby sewage caused a smell whichever direction you attempted to walk. No tea/coffee facilities as stated and no minibar as stated. In addition to the 48 bites I had from my first night in the room my son had to seperate rashes from the pool

Reviews.Title: “If you dont mind paying 15 euro for taxi per direction to rome center”
Reviews.Author: eitanh
Reviews.Content: Deluxe rooms are fine. Good food. Nice pool. Not that far from city by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Best to Avoid unless a seasoned traveller”
Reviews.Author: tomppayne
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I would say this is more an airport hotel rather than a city centre hotel, despite the fact it sits somewhere between the two in regards to distance. Secondly, if your driving here, good luck. Once we could physically see the hotel it took a further 40 mins to work out the road system to reach it. Standard Holiday Inn, breakfast is very good but evening meals are over priced. there is only a McDonalds in area so your stuck for choices. If you do not mind using the shuttle to reach the city this could be a cheap alternative to a city centre hotel if you were here for a weekend break. I stayed for a week and do not think I would have been happy to pay coach fee every day to get in to town and back. That said I would not suggest anyone try to drive in this city!!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday inn bargain in rome”
Reviews.Author: reemaz
Reviews.Content: Why do I like holiday inn express hotels-I can guarantee a certain level of service and layout that I expect of this hotel chain, if there is anything wrong I have a large company to contact at head office who will get back in touch. The food was a good variety for a buffet and plentiful and available early enough that we could head out each morning to sightsee. The hotel, though not the best and the staff, though not the most attentive, was easy to overlook considering our location and ease of access to the Vatican. What else mattered?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Staff need improvement”
Reviews.Author: Edward1980
Reviews.Content: Often when we travel we stay at the Holiday Inn and we belong to the Priority Club but would never stay at this one again. Hotel grounds is very nice and clean. Very far from the center of the city, about 30 minutes by hotel shuttle (5 euros per trip, the clerk neglected to tell us about the charge) pending traffic. Service is not very good. Internet did not work for our entire stay. Front desk could not provide us with a adapter to connect our PC. They could not find one. Snack bar... there is never anyone there to serve you, one must go looking for an employee to order a coffee or a drink. Front desk not too interested in helping with much of anything. They are always busy talking to the other employees so we moved after the first night to Hotel Duca d'Alba and had a great time with excellent service, wifi working everyday all day, they provided us with an adapter, excellent breakfast. Everything we needed they had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel with excellent service and quality breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: spaceleague
Reviews.Content: Long weekend away - we stayed in this Holiday Inn Hotel. You cant go wrong with Holiday Inn anyway - and that is the same here as well. Nice Hotel Nice Service Staff Nice Receptionists - very helpful and friendly Nice Rooms - with TV (and english programs) VERY NICE BREAKFAST - (!!!) Good Shuttle Service into the City - only 15 minutes to drive Overall - nothing to complain about

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the money”
Reviews.Author: lucy0924
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good for the price i paid. was a 20 minute ride to rome center from the hotel. take bus #246 to the cornelia subway station. Catch the subway to termini and tranfer to a or b line to go to the center of rome. Lil tip; buy the roman pass. you can visit 2 attractions and have unlimilited bus and train rides for 3 days for only 25 euro.Hotel was nice and room too with comfy beds & a very nice staff. overrall i would stay there again.The only thing is the hotel sits on top a hill. if you have a lot off luggege its going to be a little difficult. its a 10 minute walk in that hill but after you arrived, hotel has transportation into the city for 4.50 euro or public transportation is very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with very small rooms, convenient to Rome airport.”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromNJ
Reviews.Content: Our Globus tour guide told us several times that this hotel was chosen for our final night because of its proximity to the airport. This was no doubt to justify a room whose furniture had to be rearranged so that we could have space to open two suitcases at the same time, a closet with doors that were blocked by the beds and so could not be opened sufficiently to use it, and a semicircular shower stall so small that washing one's legs was a challenge. The shower head, however, was good. When we arrived the hotel desk manager found the chore of dispensing room keys to our group very confusing and, under pressure from us, delegated that chore to a desk clerk The buffet breakfast was adequate with a reasonable selection of food. No freshly brewed coffee was offered and we had to use the by now hated coffee machine used by previous hotels . It dispensed "cafe americano" that appeared to be a frothy mixture of something dark mixed with milk or cream that tasted awful. Since I like my American coffee black and to taste like coffee, and what had been dispensed into my cup did not look very appealing, I skipped coffee that morning. A shuttle bus is provided for guests desiring to go downtown (some distance away) for 3 euros. This is the kind of hotel one stays in if there is nothing better availble. In our case, many tour members suggested to our guide that Globus should find better accomodations. It was the worst hotel of our tour. My wife and I have no intention of returning should we again visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - poor location (and don't trust the hotel map!)”
Reviews.Author: dshep
Reviews.Content: Typical Holiday Inn (but better than many - very confortable beds, food very good (with a machine for squeezing oranges at breakfast - well I am easily impressed!), and staff very attentive). Location rather poor - just off a motorway - but with a McDonalds and a supermarket (which usefully sells car tyres as well - stacked in the aisle!) within three minutes walk. Having spent the day in Rome, we attempted to come back to the hotel on foot having got off the nearest subway- using the map from the hotel to get to it without walking on the motorway. Unfortunately it bore no reality to the nearby streets (new roads, blogged off roads, absent roads!) and we got a taxi from a petrol station for the last half a mile. Subway is great - 1 Euro for a journey. So we travelled all the way from the Circus Maximus (line b) to Cornelia (nearest hotel) on line a (changing line in the termini) for just 1 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the suburbs serves best before airport departure”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugVA
Reviews.Content: Globus Tours booked our group in this hotel on our last night prior to departing Rome. It is located on a highway in the suburbs and offers a shuttle to downtown, which is necessary for going out to dinner. The shuttle is reasonably priced, and you must reserve space in advance. Our rooms were not ready upon late afternoon arrival, which was a bit disappointing. However, the rooms were nicely decorated. An ample breakfast buffet was included in our tour, which was good. Despite the hotel rate, I would not base a Rome vacation out of this hotel. It serves best for one night before getting on an airplane. That said, the airport is about 30-45 minutes away. We preferred the Holiday Inn Crowne Plaza as a nicer alternative in the same area. Its shuttle is free, and the hotel is nicer--and more expensive. I would only recommend this Holiday Inn Aurelia for an overnight before flying out.

Reviews.Title: “Winter stay”
Reviews.Author: euba
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for us - do not want to get irritade by other posts. For us it was a great stay with possibility for the sightseeing as there is a free shuttle bus several times a day and after the walks enjoing yourselves in the great spa area which really had human touch of an archtect familiar with sauna area according the best of breed nordic habbits.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER WITH THE RUDEST STAFF IN ALL OF EUROPE - I AGREE!”
Reviews.Author: justgothomefromtrip
Reviews.Content: I saw the latest review and agree 100% with what the reviewer said. DUring our stay here, all I could think of was writing this to tell all people that same sentiment -- They don't care at all about customers. We stayed here with a tour group last May- 1. Service - The worst. Heartless, uncaring reception. The way they talk to you, the way they look at you as if you are so low. Maybe because I am Asian so they discriminate? I don't know but they are really not friendly. When we went to the bar to request for ice (my mom needs it to keep her medicine cool), it's as if we owe them such a huge favor. The bar tender doesn't even look at us and hands over the ice with angst. (and they give it in very small plastic cups). When there was no internet connection, I called their reception. They just said yes, there's none, it happens, we don't know when it will be restored, can't do anything about it. At that time my dad had to send something important. They don't really care. 2. Location - It's SOOOOOOO Far from Rome. When you take a cab be prepared to pay 15-20 Euros (one way). It's not accessible by Rome metro. 3. Rooms - Cramped, old Bottomline, don't stay here. Zero customer service skills; bad location.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER WITH THE RUDEST STAFF IN ALL OF EUROPE”
Reviews.Author: Bam02010
Reviews.Content: What an absolutely disgraceful hotel! The staff were the rudest, as well as nastiest, I have ever known. Where do I begin? Our flight from Rome to Paris was cancelled due to the volcanic ash. Easyjet offered to put us up in a hotel and had us driven to this dreadful place. When we arrived, as we walked to the reception desk, 2 staff members started yelling at us that we cannot check in because it is not 2pm yet. When we explained we were Easyjet passengers and were booked in, they rudely informed us that they had no booking at all. After we made numerous phone calls to Easyjet, it was organised that we stay the night here. The staff at the hotel actually refused to speak to Easyjet on the phone eventhough they are a hotel Easyjet use! Then they refused to allow us lunch, eventhough Easyjet advised us it was included. That was probably a good thing because when we got to dinner that night and advised we were with Easyjet (as the front desk had told us to do), we were ushered to a curtained off area of the very cheap dirty restaurant that had a number of very large tables that were to accommodate every Easyjet passenger and we all had to share the tables. We then ate a terrible buffet meal, where even the "cooked" vegetables still had ice on them - now, Im sorry but you can't even make this sort of thing up - it was so bad!!!! Throughout the night we were desperately trying to organise to get out of the hotel, using the EXTREMELY expensive hotel internet - at approximately 8 euro an hour (I actually can't remember the EXACT price but I am very close on that approximation). The room stank of cigarette smoke and was extremely noisey - just to top it all off! The hotel was way out of Rome, costing us 45 euro for a cab into Rome and then took us forever when we went back on a train, a bus and walking. The staff knew we were stranded, and a long way from home (Australia) and they treated us with such distaste and disregard that we have never felt so humiliated. I was so upset by their treatment that I shed quite a number of tears over it - what a waste of my tears! I did my homework on Tripadvisor before we embarked on our European adventure and not one of the hotels that I booked caused me disappointment - actually if you read my other reviews you will see that I was more than impressed! This hotel was not one I chose, but rather due to circumstances beyond ours or anyone else's control, it was picked for us. Trust Tripadvisor reviews - there are currently 42 reviews rating this hotel from average to terrible - now 43. Please heed this warning, it is the worst place we have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “A real nice stay, Ace for privacy.”
Reviews.Author: Jaysmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a three bed room with three of my friends. We are all in out late twenties. This was a real nice place. The rooms are clean, everything is organized. It is about fifteen minutes from downtown. They have a shuttle that drops you off within walking distance of everything, as well as a pick up shuttle. Mind you if you stay after 11, you will have to take a cab back. I cant say enough about this place, a real life savior. Safe and organized. English speaking receptionists. A very above average breakfast buffet. Nice privacy at night as you are away from the craziness that is downtown rome. They will drop you off next to the vatican or a little further towards the center of things. Do not hesitate here if you are looking for an outstanding, easy comfortable, mid range hotel. I went all over europe and this was one of my finest stays. Dont hesitate to send me a pm if you would like any info on rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: godbolem
Reviews.Content: Overall good hotel. Hotel is far from city center (main tourist area) but they run complimentary shuttle between hotel and main tourist places. Shuttle is available for pick up also. Good food in restaurant, complimentary broadband internet. Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “A good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: roadmap12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Rome over new years this year. We booked this hotel due to the savings (we got it for $100 Cdn./night). After reading the reviews about the hotel being so far from everything and in the middle of nowhere, I was concerned. However after arriving we found it to be a great place to stay. I will agree with the reviews saying that its away from the city center. However it has the free shuttle which we used everyday. You could stay closer but you end up doing the same amount of walking anyhow. My wife and I are around 30 and in good shape so we spend the whole day out walking. At the bottom of the hill there is a Mcdonalds a gas station, coffee shop and a grocery store. So its not like you are completely isolated. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It was nice waking up and having breakfast then hopping on the shuttle for another day out.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel - On outskirts of Rome....”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in November 2009 for a business meeting. Stayed in room 315. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel. My room was relatively newly furnished and quite clean - as was the bathroom. From a business meeting standpoint, I would stay again, however this hotel is no where close to downtown Rome. You will need the hotel shuttle, taxi (about 20 Euros) or bus to city center. As usualy, the Good, Bad, and Ugly.... Good - Cleanliness of hotel. Everything was quite clean including my entire room. - Comfort of bed. The king size bed was firm and comfortable. - There were extra pillows of varying firmness in the closet. - Breakfast/lunch - the offerings were basic, but quite nice. I think most people can find something that suits their taste. - Hotel offered a very nice shuttle bus into the city various times each day. A nice and appreciated touch. - Business facilities. I rented a room for a meeting that met my expectations. The staff did a nice job in helping me arrange the room and in ensuring everything was to my liking. - Bar was stocked with various favorite beverages and the bar manager was super nice, always meeting our needs. She was a great representative for the hotel, chatting with us about Rome and the area. - Room 315. Very basic and on the small side, but quiet and clean. Shower and bathroom was fine, if not a bit cramped. Bad - Although I knew this, the hotel is not close to city center. - Can't really walk anywhere from this hotel as it sits on a hill along a busy roadway (you will not hear the cars or at least I did not from my room.) Ugly - Nothing. :) Again, I would recommend this hotel if you needed it for a specific reason, however I do not think it's a great place to stay when traveling to Rome if you like to walk to/from your hotel because that will not be possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ovalball13
Reviews.Content: We would like to say a big thankyou to all the staff for a friendly & hlpfull aproach to customers Reception wer efficiant the Bar staff did everything with a smile & nothing was too much trouble. As for the Resaurant staff I have never been served & entertained by people so humerous & friendly nothing was too much trouble for them & seemed to know what you wanted & moved Quickley to help. It was a delight to be served by every one there specialy Marco & Franco. Thank you Every one A Great experiance of Roman Hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “The Rome Connection”
Reviews.Author: Rakhdoo
Reviews.Content: It is indeed a recommendable hotel; large (yet personal), clean, well-maintained and yes ideal if you are on short visit to Rome, or Roma as they say. If you are coming with a car, it is easy to reach this hotel as it is close to Aurelia entry/exit. But remember, that to reach the hotel you have to take a short detour as it falls on your left but due to the road-divider you have to take a shot exit in the opposite direction and take a u tun on an overbridge. There is enough parking for the coaches. The hotel also offers coach service to the city, adding comfort to your sight-seeing visit. To find a seat on this coach, you may better collect a token from the reception beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very comfortable, very modern. Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: wuensch
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 2 nights of our visit to Italy at this hotel. Our experience was great. Parking cost 6 euro per day, which was very reasonable for the Rome area. The hotel offered a free shuttle bus from the hotel to the major sites and back to the hotel. You have to book a seat on the shuttle both ways to ensure your use of the shuttle. This service was awesome. I didn't have to try to drive in the busy areas and didn't have to worry about finding some place to park near the sites we wanted to see. The bus dropped us off a block from the Vatican City at 9:30am and picked us up at 7 close to the Coliseum. It was a great day. We had a delux room which was not expensive at all. Included in room safe, mini bar, pant press, candies, water, juice, hair dryer, robe, slippers, shampoo, body wash, body lotion, shower cap, sewing kit, kettle with coffe and tea and likely more that I can't remember. The pool was not really accessable. The pool hours are from 11 am to 8 pm. Given that most people are out sightseeing during this time, it did not allow us to use the pool at all. The king size bed was very comfortable, lots of pillows. Air conditioning was great. Could set for what ever temperature you wanted. The hotel was very clean. The elevator very small. The hotel restaurant seemed a little pricey, but a McDonald's down the hill only a 5 minute walk - which made my teenage daughter very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but inconveniently located”
Reviews.Author: FrankInCA
Reviews.Content: The rooms were modern and clean, service was fine, rates were good (ours was 125 euros AAA rate for a room with three single beds). BUT...this hotel is very inconveniently located. You cannot walk to the metro, not even if you are willing to walk the 40 minutes, because there is no sidewalk next to Via Aurelia for the first 1/2 km. There is nothing within walking distance except a McDonalds, a Pans (sandwiches), and a large grocery store. Taking a taxi is expensive because they have to go the wrong way on Via Aurelia before making a U-turn -- it's 10 euros before you get back to the same spot going in the other direction, then another 10 or more into town. There's a bus line about 10 minutes away, it runs about every 20 minutes. Now the hotel does have a shuttle into town, and that's a very good thing because otherwise this hotel would be almost impossible to bear. The shuttle was prompt, big, and clean. It stops on the south side of the Vatican (on the way into town only), and then near Palazzo Venezia (about 1 km west of the Colosseum). Those are indeed the two best places to stop. BUT (again), it does NOT stop anywhere near a metro station, and that can be annoying. Also, there is a tone of traffic in Rome, so the bus rides ranged from 35 minutes to 50 minutes, whereas the metro zips along underground at about a minute or two between stops. SO, in summary, use this hotel only as a last resort. TRY TO FIND SOMETHING CLOSE TO THE METRO (orange line) and hopefully something with restaurants nearby. I saw lots of hotels on Via Aurelia further north, not far from the Cornelia station. One of those might work better, or any of the many other places in Rome. Good luck! Oh, and two minor things. We booked two rooms for 3 people each; when we checked in and got to our rooms, we found only two single beds in each room. The person at the counter seemed to imply this was our fault ("well, you listed kids" or "it came to us as two people") and basically said there was nothing she could do because there were no 3-people rooms available. I was friendly but persistent, and after about 15 minutes (including going to the room to see if a foldaway could be put in -- the porter insisted no), the person at the counter "somehow" found two rooms with 3 beds each. I don't know what that was all about. The other thing is that the rooms didn't smell particularly good; kind of a combination of a slight sewage smell (near the bathroom mostly) and a very cheap but strong perfume. No big deal, unless you're very sensitive. Oh, and even though it was really hot outside, the pool was not open until June -- strange.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: IrinaSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days. The room with a king size bed was small but clean, neat with nice modern plumbing. Hotel is located far from the Rome sites but has a very nice free shuttle service. The bus stops at Vatican and in the center of Rome.Did not go to the airport... Make sure to reserve seats in that shuttle bus, because public trasportation is inconvenient... Taxi from the airport costs 40 euros. Breakfast was good and staff is helpful. We reseve this hotel on Hotwire and got a very good deal. Cannot complain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great experience, I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mjaggerlip
Reviews.Content: On August 27th, 2008 I had to take an unexpected trip to Italy to chaperone my nephews back to their mom in Rome. I had other people arrange the trip (it is a long story) and was told they found a deal where the hotel was included in the price of the trip and the hotel was the Holiday Inn Rome-West. Being an experienced traveler I went online and read all the reviews about this establishment. Although I am a seasoned traveler to Europe the reviews of the place left me wanting; wanting to stay in a place far away from the Holiday Inn Rome-West. I am happy to report that all of my experiences there were great and the hotel was fun to stay at for my two day layover. First let me start by telling you that the free shuttle bus arrives at the airport (Leonardo da Vinci) at 8:30 AM and 1:15 PM until October 31st of this year. I believe they have a different schedule for the winter time. The bus picks you up outside of terminal C in front of the parking garage and there is a big Holiday Inn sign. The bus is painted in Holiday Inn colors as well. It is easy to find. My plane arrived at 10:00 AM and by the time I handed the kids off to my sister-in-law it was 10:30. I had her call the hotel and they told me when the next free shuttle bus was coming and told me that Taxi was another option and that I should not pay more than 40 Euro to get to the hotel. My sister-in-law said you are not expected to tip. Being the cheap American, and not wanting to pay $60 American, I opted to wait for the next free shuttle bus. I could have also taken the train, but did not. Anyway, whilst I was waiting for the bus I was approached by a few taxi drivers, and if you do not wait in the Taxi line they will approach you, and was offered a ride for 25 Euros. I decided to wait for the free ride. The ride was uneventful and quick, at maybe 25 minutes long. I got to the hotel and checked in and was given a room with a large king size bed. The room was big by European standards and average size for a Motel 6 in the states. It was a clean and very nice room. I checked in and walked down the hill to the grocery store which is one block away from the hotel. There is a McDonalds at the bottom of the hill as well but I never ate there because I wanted Italian food. I purchased a six pack of water and some food, at a bit, read a but and fell asleep trying to shake off the effects of a 20 hour plane trip from hell to Italy. Before I went to sleep I went and reserved a spot for the next morning’s shuttle to the city. I could not book the return trip because they only book the next day’s trip if that time already passed. If you want to book the 9:00 PM return trip you cannot book it until after 9:00 PM the day before. No worries, I then booked my return trip the next morning. I did eat breakfast at the hotel the next morning. I was very hungry and had not had a meal in about 20 hours. The meal is a buffet and it is very nice but cost 14 Euros, or about $20.00. The McDonalds does not serve breakfast like they serve in the US so I opted for the real food. I then boarded the bus for Rome. The bus was never crowded. Ever. I could have got on any shuttle I tried either going into Rome or coming back from Rome. This may be busier during the peak season but I had no issues whatsoever. The ride itself is about 20 minutes to the Vatican and another 10 to the heart of Rome. You can only get on the bus for the return trip at the same place they drop you off in the city, you cannot get on at the Vatican. As I mentioned above the ride back was never full and it was a stress-free ride. I also tried the pool at this hotel but the water was cold so I did not go in. The staff were all extremely helpful except for one bellhop on the last day. Other people have mentioned the small elevators, and they are very small, and I was checking out. I was on the 6th floor and had my backpack loaded. It was fairly heavy when the elevator opened it was filled with luggage and the bellhop. There was not room for me on the elevator so I asked if I could toss my bag on the elevator and meet him at the bottom (the stairs are right next to the elevator). He said OK, but I could hear him swearing and cussing at me as the doors closed and I was walking downstairs. I should have reported him but I did not. Anyway, staying here was not stressful at all. The free shuttle was easier than the subways (I have been to Rome before and stayed in town and took the public transit….this time I did not) and there was always room. The drop off point is about a six block was to the Coliseum and I ended up walking everywhere. I walked from the Vatican to the bus stop the next day, which was maybe a 15 block walk. I took the side streets and tried to get lost because you always find cool things when you are lost, but it is hard to get lost in Rome. Every person I dealt with spoke English except the bellhop. Every person I dealt with was professional and courteous, except the bellhop. I had no issues whatsoever with the hotel itself. The only thing I can think of to complain about, besides the bellhop, was that there is a stairway that is about half way up the hill that empties into the McDonald’s parking lot. It was overgrown with weeds, tree branches, and cluttered with litter. If they would trim the trees, weed the path and pick up the trash there, it would really help their image on the outside grounds. I used the stairs anyway, and this is only a small complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Beamy
Reviews.Content: Booked a Deluxe double room and really enjoyed our stay. Hotel is very clean, modern, renovated, with a gym and swimming pool. The room was great and spacious, big flatscreen TV, trouserpress, bathrobe and slippers, electric kettle with complimentary set of teas and coffees, a complimentary bottle of water and fruit juice every day. Breakfast was very good, too, with fresh italian ham and mozzarella, fresh fruit and hot omelette (and many other things of course). As the hotel was outside of the centre (somewhat 4 kilometers to Vatican), there was a courtesy air-conditioned bus dropping guests in the city centre and picking them up at certain times, so we did not mind staying outside of Rome. There was a nice big Panorama supermarket nearby, so one could buy fruit, snacks and water there without paying double price in the city centre. For those on a budget there is a McDonalds just outside the hotel. The staff was nice and polite, the only improvement I would ask for would be if they kindly offered help with bags for those who check out. Otherwise - absolutely delighed with the place!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews here helped us with the trip”
Reviews.Author: Kendall-Indiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn West prior to a cruise embarkation and again at the end of the cruise. I will say that the reviews on this site were very helpful. My expectations were pretty low going into it as so many people had complained about the showers, elevators, and beds. I was pleasantly surprised by the modern feel of the hotel and am glad we chose here to stay. It is true that the hotel is no where near the center of Rome but it is accessible by cab and I heard good things about the free shuttle, although there were limited runs. They did have two drop off sites -- one near the Vatican and the other nearer the Colesseum. Let's start with some of the troubles we had. First, the first time we stayed there we stayed for two nights and had trouble with the air conditioner. Finally, someone we had met who was also on our cruise told us about a hidden switch. I actually had seen the little switch at the bottom of the air conditioning controls, but when I switched it on the light went from green to yellow and I just figured green was better. I was wrong -- yellow is the way to go. We finally figured this out and our second night was pretty cool and our return night was perfect. The restaurant was fine. We like our food but it took a little while to figure out the system. They have someone who sits you, someone who takes your order, and then someone who comes and gets that order and then, in turn, is your server. On some occassions English was not spoken much at all, and on others it wasn't a problem. They had buffets at breakfast and at the lunch on Sunday. We ordered off the menu for dinner and lunch. We had good sausage one night, a pizza the next night, and then i had a vegetable ravioli I really liked the final night. You can also order sandwhiches and get drinks from the bar around the opposite side of the front desk. Someone on here had mentioned that the showers were like coffins so I expected something really bad. The first two nights we had a double room and the shower was big. Our last night was in a king bed and the shower was much more coffin-like -- like being in a tube. That bathroom was very small in general, with the arrangement of the bidet behind the bathroom door, it was larger if you kept the door closed. Regarding the elevators, I wanted to share a quick tip. When we were trying to load our 5 suitcases into the elevator, a kind staff person came by and showed us the service elevator right around the corner. So we just pushed our entire cart on and up we went. We used a bellhop to leave and he was very timely. On our return, we used the service elevator both times. I wanted folks to know about this as it is true that the elevators (2 of them) are very small. TV is limited. Lots of Italian tv channels but only 2 English speaking -- an overseas version of CNN and MTV. In times of satellites it seems like have a few more English speaking options, especially at a Holiday Inn, would have been nice. Check in and check out was easy and the staff was professional and helpful, although not very cheery at all. I'm not sure I ever saw one of them smile. We used a safe they have to store our passports and money and that was helpful. They also always made our cab reservations and that worked like clockwork for us. They would give you the cab number so when it pulled up you would know which one was yours if other folks were waiting. All in all, if you want to stay in a more modern hotel and don't mind the travel into Rome, I would suggest the Holiday Inn West. (By the way -- the McDonalds and gas station is down a long hill, but it's the driveway to the hotel and therefore not as dangerous as I had pictured from the reviews here. We also saw ladies of the evening when we went to the airport at 2 a.m. -- not in front of the hotel, but on the driveway up) Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent shuttle into Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rovers426
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find, which was very welcome in the Rome traffic and the car park was excellent and cheap. The room was quite small but we had a lovely view The restaurant was very good with friendly staff. The free shuttle bus into the centre of Rome was very good, but we had to stay out all day as it would have been very difficult to get back to the hotel any other way.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel but not close to centre”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to a normal holiday inn standard so provides a good quality of accomodation. The hotel has a good breakfast but is about a half an hour train trip to central rome. If you have plenty of time and dont mind the commute then this is a great value hotel and modern compared to the other style hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: TheImproperBostonian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Rome West for three nights in October as part of a business meeting. This was my first trip to Rome (and Italy), and it was disappointing to be staying at this hotel so far from the city. It would have been great to be able to walk around the city a bit in between my meetings, but this hotel is a 30+ minute and 20 Euro drive (don't let the kms fool you - the traffic is amazing! it took us an hour to get in for dinner on a Thursday night!) If you're staying there to sightseeing, any money you save by staying at a hotel outside the city would easily be asborbed by taxi fare. The hotel does have a shuttle, but in order to maximize my very limited time for sightseeing, I didn't really have enough time to wait for the next run. The hotel itself was OK - 1970's decor, but clean. The staff wasn't not very friendly, but I found that to be the case throughout Rome. There is a flatscreen tv in the room (and some sort of steamer thing), but you have to request an iron and ironing board. They have 3 computers in the lobby that you can pay to use the internet, and then wireless in the rooms. Bed was very stiff and linens not very comfortable. At this stage, I guess I'm used to staying in nicer hotels. The hotel is located next to a major road, and there's a McDonalds within walking distance and perhaps a grocery store (not much!). While I did feel safe within the hotel, I would not (especially as a single woman) walk around the hotel property at night. We noticed a number of "women of the night" hanging out around the hotel as we arrived back after dinner each night. Not interested in seeing that side of Rome! There were a bunch of tour groups staying at the hotel, and I suppose it's a decent place for a last stop before heading to the airport (which was only 30 min away). I will not choose to stay here again, but if it's a business meeting and I have to, it would be OK.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Was ideal for our purposes......”
Reviews.Author: IKB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice in the same trip. We had booked a villa in Tuscany from Sat to Sat, but our flight out was on the Friday and flight back on the Sunday, because of the limited flights into Rome with our local budget airline (Jet2). We wanted to visit Rome anyway, so our party of three couples booked rooms here for an overnight stay at the start and end of our holiday. It turned out to be an excellent choice. Clean, decent sized rooms and a modern airy feel about the lobby/lounge areas. The breakfast was fine and one of the evenings when we arrived we were very late, but they went out of their way to ensure we were able to eat in the restaurant. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The shuttle bus is great. You need to make sure you book it for every trip you want to make to Rome or to the airport as it is understandably very popular. We had to use taxis on a couple of occasions and this wasn't cheap, but it was well compensated for by the great sightseeing available. The swimming pool and surrounding area was great for chilling out after a trip to see the sights, with big towels available and a helpful attendant. It was perfect for our trip and we will certainly consider using it again for that type of trip, but don't book it if you want a central Rome location! With a hire car you are straight out on to the motorway network and you don't have the hassle (understatement?) of dealing with central Rome traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yearbook1
Reviews.Content: Clean, reasonable place to stay. It is way outside Rome and is a 20E cab ride away from Rome and a 45E ride from the airport or train station. However, the hotel maintains a shuttle to town or the airport. The town shuttle is doable. But your timing has to be right for the airport shuttle. Ours was not. Food is very expensive there. However, just at the bottom of the hill is a McDonalds and a grocery store. You can easily use both to save money. Rooms are small but so are many in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all costs”
Reviews.Author: ulyth_7
Reviews.Content: We are two professional women who took a 5 day break at this hotel. We would never use it again for either business or pleasure. It is possibly the worst hotel at which we have ever stayed. With a few rare exceptions, the staff from the pool attendant to the duty managers were surly, unhelpful, incompetent and sometimes obstructive. The staff have lost the plot. They find the guests an inconvenience and sometimes a nuisance! We made the best of it and managed to have a good time, despite the best efforts of the staff to prevent us doing so. The rooms are very small and gloomy. The garden area is small and scrubby, not pleasant. Never again. Do not go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: marketlady
Reviews.Content: We were part of a tour, so the hotel was chosen for us. Of the 8 hotels we stayed in, this one was the worst. The staff has an attitude problem, and were very unhelpful. We paid a very large price for a very small drink (barmaid didn't measure, just poured). Felt short-changed. Breakfast was mediocre at best. Would not return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Location”
Reviews.Author: mongkang
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is out in the industrial parts of Rome (west) running off a highway with heavy traffic and with no pedestrian crossing nor sidewalks. In Australia we say it is out in the whoop whoop (out of no where) This came as a shock and really not ideal for tourists! At night it is dark and the only shops are McDonalds and a mini supermart about 1/2 kilometer from hotel. You feel imprisioned as there are no places of interest, cafes or restaurants within walking distance if you don't wish to eat in the hotel. You are literally dependent on public transport and having meals in the hotel. Seems to me this is what the hotel is cashing in on. The lift is so tiny that it cannot take more than two people with luggage; 4 at the most without luggage. My advice is to spend abit more on a hotel closer to central Rome and don't waste your time travelling to and from this hotel to get to places. I will never stay in this hotel again purely due to its most unsuitable location! Trafalgar Tours - take note. This hotel has to be the worst you put us in, location wise!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: mac34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is poorly located for the independent traveler unless you're traveling by car. It was selected by our tour company and we stayed there the last night. It appears to be used by several tour companies for the tour's last night in Rome. It was an rather expensive taxi ride for us to get back to the central train station to continue our itinerary. Hotel was good. Breakfast bar was one of the best we had seen.

Reviews.Title: “not very good”
Reviews.Author: CHELSEACHEF
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some redeeming qualities. If you are driving, there is a big parking lot, but it isn't free. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room size was adequate and the in room mini bar was well stocked and the overall cleanliness were all up to snuff. We booked direct with the hotel and got a great rate during off season. That being said, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It is in a terrbile location for a tourist and it would be virtually inpossible to use public transport. It is not in the city centre, and if you are in Rome as a tourist, there are only 100 hotels in more ideal locations for a similar rate. My girlfriend and I stayed here for 1 night and that was enough. Another thing that I found that was not convenient was the size of the elevator. Only one person at a time can fit in this lift if you have any sort of bag to carry up.I only booked it because I thought it would be more convenient to get to fiumicino, but I was wrong to do that. If you ask me point blank, in which area would I stay if I were going to Rome again, I would say almost anywhere in the city centre. This hotel is in the so called green belt. Not at all convenient unless walking on the side of a highway into oncoming traffic at night time sounds like the kind of fun that you would fly overseas to have. We took the bus back to the hotel on that night and as the bus passed the hotel, we signalled for a stop. The bus driver stopped about 1 kilometer down the road from the hotel. It was such an odd place to be let off of the bus some priests asked us if we were lost because it seemed so odd to them that anyone would want to get off the bus on the side of the highway and want to walk. It was a very dangerous hike back to the hotel from the bus stop. What a nightmare. Stay near Termini, Vatican City or near the ancient sites. Trastevere is a really fun place if you have a taste for adventure and gastronomic pleasure. The area around the Campo de Fiore is also very lively. Long story short, do not waste your time in Rome staying out in the burbs. Enjoy the bustle and the convenience of public transport or the ability to walk to see or eat something good. This hotel is way out there with nothing of interest as far as dining unless you want to have your dinner at the autogrill.

Reviews.Title: “Typical American Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dinocas
Reviews.Content: Rather old hotel, needs some rennovatig. very small rooms, ours was dusty, staff was ok, breakfast was good. location average. Typical American Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: tunjio
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for a Week with my wife and 10 month old son for a week and it was perfect for our stay. Although not too close to the city centre, this wass suitsable for us as it was a very quiet atmosphere. The staff were very pleasant and helpful they cannot be faulted. Breakfast was not to be missed as it had enugh variety and set us up well for the rest of the day. The courtesy bus service was also very useful and convenient, dropping us right at the city centre and picking us up after the long hard trek around rome. Nice swimming pool as well and all in all it was an enjoyable week for us. We will definetely go back and stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MustTravelMore1979
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. It unfortunately did not live up to what I had been led to believe. The location of the hotel is terrible. Although there is a shuttle bus service it is not sufficient. It advertises a pick up from the airport but this trip only happens twice before 12pm (not helpful if like us you land at 12.40) and then later in the evening. Trips into Rome city centre are not much better. We arrived at the hotel at 13.45 and were told that the next bus would leave the hotel at 15.40. The service is often also fully booked, especially the early trips into the centre and the late return trips back. It only has a couple of drop off points and one place to pick up from. We managed to get a place on the bus once back to the hotel and had great difficulty finding the pick up point from the map we were given and spent almost an hour walking around Rome at night. It may be easier if you manage to get dropped off in the morning so you know where you're going. The only other way into the city centre is to get a public bus and then the metro. To get to the bus stop you have to walk alongside a very busy 3 lane road - there is no pavement/sidewalk - which felt quite risky. The public buses are always extremely busy and you may find it difficult to find your correct stop. Some of the hotel staff were not very helpful and in some cases quite rude. I overheard one guest complaining about his room and the receptionist told him that he would have to speak to another receptionist in the morning and walked away from him. I unfortunately booked this hotel through lastminute where it was described as close to Romes attractions which is why I booked there. I therefore assumed that it was walkable or at least near to a metro station. Be warned if you are looking for a hotel close to attractions this is not the place for you. The price was quite reasonable (although my deal did not include breakfast) and the rooms were clean if a bit small. Although the price was quite good I would never consider staying here again and would be much happier to pay slightly more for a more central hotel. Make sure you are completely aware of what you are getting before you book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but Location not the best”
Reviews.Author: Rick H
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights using 3 rooms. Hotel is clean and typical HolidayInn. Staff was helpful. We book a tour at 6:30am for the 7am tour! Generally quiet. Beds ok, but shower very small. Credit card machine didn't work during check out. Wireless Internet available for resonable charge with your computer. Location is a minus but shuttle bus helped, but book early, it's free. I would book something closer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but first time US travelers beware”
Reviews.Author: grjtoo
Reviews.Content: My title was a little overboard, but this was my first time traveling to Europe and I really wanted to stay closer to downtown, but after reading some of the travel books, I was a little scared about the unknown. So, I went for old trusty Holiday Inn. The hotel itself was clean and nice enough. The beds, however, were a little more or a little less I should say than I bargained for. If you're in the US and used to traveling, you have a certain level of expectation about the size of your bed. Evidently Europeans are smaller than we are because these beds were horribly small. My brother is 6'3 and he had a lot of leg hanging off his single bed. I'm 5'11" and I didn't fit comfortably on the bed. The other alert is, because we were a good distance from downtown, we cabbed it back and forth. I thought NYC cabbies were bad. I seriously felt like we took our lives in our hands by taking a cab in Rome. Obviously, this is not the hotel's fault. But it is just a warning if you're a first time overseas traveler like I was. Do a little extra research and stay somewhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before we flew out of Rome. It is convenient to the airport as long as there are no traffic jams. A very nice updated Holiday Inn--business as usual. The bath had a small shower stall. Breakfast was fine. Staff OK. There is a McDonalds (if you need one) at the bottom of a steep hill. If you turn left there is a supermarket which sells wine much cheaper than the airport!

Reviews.Title: “lovely room but location let it down”
Reviews.Author: jessie carr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 days in Rome staying at the Holiday Inn Rome West, I had not meant to book this hotel but through my own error online I did. The location was not good and whilst there is a shuttel bus which we used this was not frequent enough and there were no late evening return journeys to the hotel. I agree that the metro was quite accessible, however if you wanted to get there it was a 13 euro taxi ride, unless you used the bus no 246. Please note the correct exit from the cornelia metro station otherwise you will be wandering about looking for the bus station which when it is dark is difficult and quite unnerving. On leaving the bus on the return journey you have a short walk up a dark back road into the hotel grounds. The room we stayed in room no 512 was very good an enormous kingsized bed plenty of room to move around the room and a nice sized en suite. Breakfast was 11 euros each and was a substantial buffet with something to please all nationalities. Mini bar in the room however prices were very steep and we used the panaramo supermarket to stock up our own drinks in the fridge, beer 2.5 euros for 4 cans. If you are going to the sistine chapel make sure you get there as early as possible otherwise the queues are massive and with the opening hours in winter quite short you may not get in. Due to the location and the feasibility of getting back we made the decision of staying out all day rather than waste time going back and forth to go out in the evening. This allowed us to see everything we wanted to, but was very tiring and meant we were out 10 -12 hours each day. The hotel provides a free safety deposit box but you need to ask as soon as you check in as they are limited. You need to book your shuttle bus journeys the day before to ensure you can get a place. If I went again the only reason I would not choose this hotel is because of its location, if you are not concerned about the price of taxis or are happy to stay in the hotel every evening using their restaurant and bar then you should enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: anthjonoaidmaddie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from one weeks holiday at the holiday inn rome west. Our room was very spacious, brand new with beautiful fitted bathroom and queen size bed. The free shuttle bus was great saving 26 euros each way. You do have to book this but only the day or night before. The pool was great as it was 42, our 3 year old son really enjoyed this, they had a pool assistant there every day from 11am - 8pm. The staff were very friendly and advised us where to visit and the breakfast was very enjoyable with lots of choice from fried eggs to rice crispies with it being a buffet you could eat as much as you liked. We ate a couple of times in the restaurant and the dishes were very tasty and not very expensive a main course for about 10 - 14 euros, again the restaurant staff were very friendly. There is a Macdonalds at the bottom of the hill about 10 mins away, and a very big supermarket which sold flip flops to baked pizza's, lovely freshly baked bread and all the essentials you would ever need. Anthea Aidan Jonathan Waite Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel in a terrible location”
Reviews.Author: GrahamSKing
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. We had hoped that, being a Holiday Inn, it would have been of a reasonable standard and descent value, and that even though it was out of town, it would have been accessible via public transport. The standard of the hotel left much to be desired. The room was small but clean and a little dated. Our main complaint with the room itself was the bed.
