It was too short for me and my feet hung off the end (I'm only 6' tall). It was hard, and worst of all, the 'double' was actually two singles attached to each other, so there was an uncomfortable join down the middle. Breakfast was passable but nothing spectacular. Location was the really down side. As other posts have indicated, the only realistic way to get to/from the hotel is by taxi. The average cost for us was 20Euro each way. Having said that, we did use a bus to get down to the city centre in the mornings, but that required some knowledge of the system. We relied on other people helping us out. Getting a taxi back in the evenings was no problem. They were readily available at all the taxi ranks. We had a great time in Rome, but pretty much despite the hotel rather than because of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain..loved it”
Reviews.Author: jmb994
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last 2 nights of our trip to utilize the free shuttle to the airport. First, the good: obviously the free shuttle to the airport..you have to reserve the day before for any shuttle trips..so what..no problem. The shuttle is roomy and comfortable, the drivers friendly and polite. The room was clean and large enough by European standards. The shower was small. Oh and the elevator is tiny..but hey you're in Europe. The restaurant was very reasonable for dinner. It is very nicely decorated, and my husband and I had 2 wonderfully prepared entrees (veal and cannelloni), a salad, basket of bread. and a bottle of the house red wine for 34 euros (12% service fee/tip included). We thought this was a terrific bargain. The waiter was excellent. We felt very safe at this hotel, and utilized the McDonalds, another sandwich shop next to McDonalds, and the Panorama Supermarket ( turn left at McDonalds..go about 1/2 block). Wonderful European beer at less than 2 Euro a six pack or great selection of wines for 2 Euro or so. Also big selection of regional foods. cheeses. olives etc. and a department store. We took the hotel shuttle to the Marcello Teatro drop, which is very near the coliseum and also near the pickup for the Bus 110. This bus will tour you and let you get off and on at Rome's biggest attractions. They have earphones and an English tour by tape. You can even ride in the open air on top of the bus if you like. It was 13 euros and excellent. The pickup was about 2 blocks from Teatro Marcello..ask shop owners for directions..you will see bus 110 sign. As for the shuttle you do have to pre-book with the hotel staff your pickup and drop off times the day before..but that's easy. This is a fantastic place, at least for the last night or so of your visit to Rome. Another traveler we met from SC said the taxi trip from FCO was 80-100 euros, and we got it free. Also through the hotel's web site we only paid 72 euros per night. We loved it and would certainly stay again. Oh..one major disappointment..no coffee machine in room, though website says there is one. We complained to staff, and they said we could order from room service..gee thanks! Was 4 euros per cup..get your coffee at McDonalds. Oh and one other thing, if you come in by air, take the train to Termini and take a cab from there (hotel says 16 euro or so). The hotel had told us to take Line A subway to Cornelia and then bus 246 to hotel. It was pretty rugged with luggage, and there was about a 50' walk on a freeway and then a walk high on the hill where the hotel is. This is torture with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!! If I could give this zero stars, I would”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of choosing this hotel for my week-long vacation to Rome. The Travelocity site made is sound like it was very close to the city, and I thought, "how bad can it be?" First, the location. The hotel is not located near anything except a McDonalds, a gas station, and a grocery store. It is about 30-40 Euro for a taxi ride into the city. The Metro stop is very far away, and the hotel itself appears to be located in an industrial wasteland. Thus, you are completely dependent on the (poor) shuttle service for everything, including your meals. The last shuttle back to the hotel is at 7:50PM, and since no Italian resturant is open until 7:00 at the very earliest, you cannot eat a proper meal in the city. You have to either buy food at the grocery store (thank god for that grocery store!), eat at McDonald's/gas station, eat at the hotel dining room ($$$), or starve. I never once had a real Italian meal during my stay. Second, the rooms. I agree with the previous reviewer that the shower is indeed like a standing glass casket. I traveled with two family members, and no more than two people can squeeze into the tiny bathroom at a time. The view is non-existent - only a bare construction lot. The sheets were not changed on a regular basis - my mother dropped a strawberry on a sheet and the resulting red stain remained there for several days. Third, the service. The front desk staff was incredibly rude and unhelpful. I have never encountered such poor customer service before. I asked them to call Borghese Gallery to switch the time of my reservation, as I could not do it myself because I had to catch the shuttle bus (more on this later). They never called. When we checked in, we were told that we did not have a continental breakfast. When we checked out, we were asked why we never used our continental breakfasts!!! I'm not sure which is correct, but if we did have that continental breakfast, it would've saved us much inconvenience and money. Fourth, the "tours" that the Holiday Inn offers. We decided to take the one- day "tour" to Florence that was arranged through the hotel. What a joke! The ride to Florence is about 3-4 hours on that bus, and when you arrive there, this is your itinerary: 10 minutes at Michelangelo's "David", 10 minutes each at two churches, 10 minutes at a piazza, ONE FULL HOUR at a leather factory where you are expected to buy something, and then lunch. Why not more time at the museum? Because the tour guides do not receive commission from the museum like they do from these stores! The lunch was also sub-par, although better than the aforementioned McDonald's. After lunch, you pile back into the bus for the 3-4 hour ride back to Rome. The tour guide also did not speak English well, and most people could not understand anything that he said. This cost about 350 Euro for 3 people. Last, the shuttle bus. The shuttle schedule is extremely limited, and you need to reserve a spot on the bus in advance. If you didn't happen to know this little secret, and the bus is full and you don't have a ticket, guess what happens. You're stuck with a 40 Euro taxi trip back to the hotel. I saw many irate people get kicked off the bus because it was too full. I know this review is long, but here it is in summary: The Holiday Inn Rome West is not worth even considering when making your travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “bathroom shower is a standing glass casket”
Reviews.Author: travelagencyowner
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location and setting was made for Italian businessmen with cars, not for any tourists who want to see or be near anything. The front desk staff (Lazy Men) were not friendly and did not want to help the guestsl The exception was a friendly front desk blonde girl, who was very cooperative and scowled upon by her fellow workers since they wanted her to do all the work. Globus Cosmos tours uses this hotel for their bus groups and that works well, because the bus is always there for their tours to other parts of the city. It is 20-30 minutes to anywhere from this hotel. There is no place to walk and if you are not with a bus group avoid this hotel and pay more to be in the central Rome. My advice "Forget about It!"

Reviews.Title: “Long distance to Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival in Rome, we got a taxi to the hotel. The journey seemed long. This was not helped by traffic congestion. The hotel is located in a very remote area, not within walking distance to tourist attractions. It was quite a distance from the city centre and the Vatican. Staff were not overly friendly or in a hurry to help. I made several requests of the front desk and had wait a considerable amount of time. Breakfast was very good, but cutlery was nowhere to be seen. Very disorganised! Rooms are OK size for two people, and comfortably appointed, but our rooms had no air conditioning. This was very disappointing as we stayed during the warm month of September. Next time I will consider something closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off I agree the Hotel is a little far from everything, however the bus stop is less than a block away and for 16 Euros you can ride it (unlimited) including the subway and any other form of Public transpotation for a full week! You walk out the front, go right, then right down the drive then left at a rolling gate then it curves around the behind the Jaguar dealer then left to the stairs of the pedestrian overpass and you can see the bus stop when you come down the other side. (You don't put any money in on your first ride. However as your riding look for a "Tobacchi" shop and purchase your ticket there, run it through the little yellow machine on the bus when you get back on.)Take the 246 bus to the Metro ("subway" look for the Red square with the M in the center usually on all four corners) Cornelia station and you can get to most anywhere you want to go. The Hotel location is actually nice cause you are away from the crowds. They have a nice grocery store nearby and a McDonalds if you miss having coffee. For the price you definitely can't beat it! Yes there is alot of walking involved. I thought Rome was fasinating and enjoyed taking it in as I walked instead of zooming by in a vehicle. I lost five pounds and feel great! Walking is good for you! Do it! Our room was very small (If you can imagine a lower deck room on a cruise ship it's about the same size) but who spends time in their room? You're in Rome!! you wake up, leave, and don't return till late to shower and sleep only to repeat the process again. Get out and explore! When they say they speak English, they really don't well enough to understand everything. I asked for a wash cloth and they sent up a towel. I did not have any problems getting what I needed and they responded promptly. I found the service anywhere in Rome is not like we find in the USA however it was adequate. I will stay here when I return again and do recommend it! I would not recommend if your beyond using Public transportation, don't like to prolong your life by exercising, and like wasting your $$ for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel 1 night. the hotel has a shuttle service to downtown Roma . we took the shuttle and came back by taxi because the shuttle service ends around 800p. The breakfast is great We enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelerDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a terrible location - not close to the airport (although it is advertised that way), and definitely not close to the downtown (30 euros by taxi). Also, taxis don't want to go there because they cannot pick up other people from that area. It is in a very poor, industrial area, and taking the bus to downtown Rome takes an hour!!! They have a shuttle that goes downtown and one to the airport but it is more of a joke! They have only 3 departures a day from the hotel to the airport and they go into the city every 2 hours. Shuttle stops working at 7PM. Very inconvenient!!! Don't stay there. Rooms smelled like cigarette smoke and you have to pay for internet!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location...”
Reviews.Author: travelqueens
Reviews.Content: Hotel is cheap and the concierge was friendly and helpful! Ok, now that we're done with the hotel's plus points...let's move on to its downside. No matter what anyone tells you, this hotel is NOT within walking distance of the subway station, nor is it close to Roma Termini train station. The hotel is also a long distance away from the Colosseum, Vatican, Piazza Navona, Trevi Foutain, Pantheon and every other tourist destination you can think of. The hotel does offer a "tram" service to and from the center of town to make it more convenient to get to tourist sites, however, the tram only has certain timings and may not always be convenient. The hotel room itself was also a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this hotel in july 2004.this hotel is a safe bet, as another reviewer said. but there are no restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, leaving you with either the hotel restaurant or the mcdonalds next door. as we didnt come with any type of tour could take the helpful shuttle bus to the centre but as the last time the bus returns to the hotel is 7.50, not good if you want to eat out. as we'd never been to rome before this hotel was ok but staying in the centre would be more worth your while, this hotel is close to nothing. the staff are polite, the swimming pool is good, the shuttle service is helpful but stay closer to the centre.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Rome Aurelia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Aurelia Km 8,400, 00163 Rome, Italy
